questions.question_text:
A company is moving to the AWS Cloud to reduce operational overhead for its application infrastructure.

Which IT operation will the company still be responsible for after the migration to AWS?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D. Configuration of IAM access controls

choices.B: Backups of data that is stored in Amazon Aurora
choices.C: Termination of Amazon EC2 instances that are managed by AWS Auto Scaling
choices.A: Security patching of AWS Elastic Beanstalk

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: Governance

The Options A, B and D are simply not part of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework.

Selected Answer: C
C. Governance

"The AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF) leverages AWS experience and best practices to help you digitally transform and accelerate your business outcomes through innovative use of AWS. AWS CAF identifies specific organizational capabilities that underpin successful cloud transformations. These capabilities provide best practice guidance that helps you improve your cloud readiness. AWS CAF groups its capabilities in six perspectives: Business, People, Governance, Platform, Security, and Operations. "

https://aws.amazon.com/cloud-adoption-framework/

questions.question_text: Which option is a perspective that includes foundational capabilities of the AWS Cloud Adoption Framework (AWS CAF)?

discussion.content:
A and B are both services that are commonly used in event-driven, microservices-based architectures.
AWS Application Migration Service is a service that helps you migrate applications from on-premises to AWS. It is not specifically designed to help with the development of event-driven microservices-based applications. Therefore, it is not a suitable option for this scenario.

Selected Answer: AB
A. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
B. AWS Lambda

"Q: Can I use Amazon SQS with other AWS services?

Yes. You can make your applications more flexible and scalable by using Amazon SQS with compute services such as Amazon EC2, Amazon Elastic Container Service (ECS), and AWS Lambda, as well as with storage and database services such as Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) and Amazon DynamoDB."

https://aws.amazon.com/sqs/faqs/#Features.2C_functionality.2C_and_interfaces

Selected Answer: AB
A and B are answers

Selected Answer: AB
A. Amazon Simple Queue Service (Amazon SQS)
B. AWS Lambda

Selected Answer: AB
A&B are the correct answers.
A and B is the most suitable for development of event driven microservices based application. AWS Application Migration Service is wrong.

questions.question_text:
A company is running an order processing system on Amazon EC2 instances. The company wants to migrate to an event-driven, microservices-based application.

Which combination of AWS services can the application use to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
D. Tuning database queries.

AWS Support provides technical support for AWS services and features, which includes answering "how to" questions, resolving service issues, and providing guidance and best practices. However, tuning database queries is typically considered the responsibility of the customer or the application development team, as it involves optimizing the database schema, indexing, and query structure to improve performance. AWS Support can provide guidance and recommendations on best practices for database optimization, but actual query tuning would be out of scope for their services.

Selected Answer: D
Answer D: Tuning Database queries

Selected Answer: D
D. Tuning database queries

choices.B: Answering "how to" questions on AWS services and features
choices.A: Solving problems detected by Amazon EC2 health checks

questions.question_text: Which activity is considered out of scope for AWS Support?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C: EC2

Selected Answer: C
C. Amazon EC2

"Customers that deploy an Amazon EC2 instance are responsible for management of the guest operating system (including updates and security patches), any application software or utilities installed by the customer on the instances, and the configuration of the AWS-provided firewall (called a security group) on each instance."

https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/#:~:text=Customers%20that%20deploy,on%20each%20instance.

Selected Answer: C
When using Amazon EC2, you are responsible for maintaining and managing the operating system of the instances you launch. This includes tasks such as installing software updates, managing security configurations, and ensuring the overall health and maintenance of the operating system.

questions.question_text: For which AWS service is the customer responsible for maintaining the underlying operating system?
